question:
Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.
Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letter explain why you are writing, describe your circumstances, ask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enroll in the course
text: I am writing with regards to the advertisement that published in "The News" about excel computer course and I am much interested in taking this course.

As per the information on an advert, this program is for those who have completed an intermediate level, ,However, I do not have any initial knowledge of computing because I never studied computers in my school, but still i always wanted to learn that subject.

Computer studies were not really popular in schools in past, but nowadays its use is a must in every field of life. I am an accountant and my job role is to update accounts manually, i have strong pressure from my company to handle accounts while using the software. So I am in bad need to learn this course as it is really beneficial for me.

I would like to request you please, make some arrangements to enroll me on this program, I would be really happy if you could do this favor for me, also I am ready to devote my spare time in order to cover the initial level.
I look forward to receiving your response and hope to get enrol in your institute.
